headers.access-control-expose-headers: ETag, Link, Location, Retry-After, X-GitHub-OTP, X-RateLimit-Limit, X-RateLimit-Remaining, X-RateLimit-Used, X-RateLimit-Resource, X-RateLimit-Reset, X-OAuth-Scopes, X-Accepted-OAuth-Scopes, X-Poll-Interval, X-GitHub-Media-Type, X-GitHub-SSO, X-GitHub-Request-Id, Deprecation, Sunset

nodes.body: Thanks for reporting this issue. Indeed, the current implementation of OpenAIResponsesCompactionSession only supports server managed conversation data, which relies on previous_response_id under the hood. However, responses.compact API supports inputs array without previous_response_id, so the use case you mentioned should be supported as well. We'll adjust the internal behavior to support both use cases.

Thanks for the quick confirmation and the detailed explanation. I really appreciate you planning to adjust the internal behavior to support both the previous_response_id (server-managed) flow and the inputs-only use case. If helpful, I can provide a minimal repro and I’m happy to help test/verify the fix once there’s a patch.
